Summary: Very smooth tasting but a little too sweet for my tastes
text:
My wife and I are big coffee drinkers. As an International Flight Attendant, she has traveled a lot to Europe and says that this illy cappucino tastes like a "European" coffee. When I asked her what she meant by that she said that it was smooth and mellow. I concur. And I guess it makes sense that it tastes "European" because illy is an Italian company.

This tastes nothing like a Starbucks French Roast or Sumatra, for instance, which are both dark and bold tasting. The illy Cappucino is way more subtle in its flavor. Subtle but still there is a distinctive coffee taste that I enjoyed. There is added sugar however and for me, it's a too sweet. I do not normally sweeten my coffee beverages much if at all. Many people do sweeten their coffee though and for those, the sweetness may be just right for them.

The ingredients seem pretty straightforward and that is good. Regarding the sugar, a single serving, 1 cup, contains 18g of sugar. A teaspoon of sugar is approximately 4g so this essentially has the equivalent of 4.5 teaspoons of sugar per serving.

I drank and I liked. But I would not purchase again because of the added sugar. But if you don't mind the sugar and want a convenient way to enjoy a cappucino coffee beverage, you'd probably like this illy coffee drink.
